human_nobility.description: All human noble houses / aristocracy factions (e.g., House Brackenwold and other vassal houses).

longhorn_nobility.description: All longhorn/breggle noble houses of the High Wold.

pairs.notes: Atanuwë hates the Church; Church fears Atanuwë.
Atanuwë hates human nobility; nobles fear crookhorn incursions.
Longhorn nobility fear and hate Atanuwë for twisting breggles into crookhorns.
Witches view Atanuwë as an imposter and principal threat; seek to confine it.
Drune lust after Atanuwë’s power and seek revenge; relationship is tense/transactional.
Mutual lack of awareness in current era (Cold Prince and Atanuwë).
Cold Prince hates Church/humans who deposed him; Church dismisses him as legend.
Cold Prince hates human nobility; human nobles dismiss him as legend.
Cold Prince hates but may treat with Drune; Drune ward against his return.
Cold Prince seeks to rekindle longhorn loyalty; longhorns may dismiss as legend.
Cold Prince historically paid witches little heed; witches largely ignore him.
Church seeks to eradicate Drune; Drune disdain Church.
Human nobility turning against Drune; Drune disdain mortals.
Drune mistrust breggles; longhorn nobility fear and hate Drune.
Ancient pacts deter interference; occasional collaboration.
Church and human nobility largely unified; clergy accepts aristocratic advice.
Humans and longhorns have ruled side by side in the High Wold; stable alliance.
Human nobility largely neutral/tolerant; House Brackenwold has witchcraft history.
Human nobility dismisses the Cold Prince as legend.
Church hates witches and seeks to eradicate them; witches hide from Church.
Church tolerates longhorn nobility as an uncomfortable relic.
Church dismisses the Cold Prince as superstition/legend.
Longhorn nobility largely ignores witches; occasional breggle women become witches.
Longhorn nobility dismisses the Cold Prince as legend.

provenance.notes: Major faction relationship statements converted into symmetric pair scores for mechanical use.
